page.title: 08Transport in Solihull
page.content: The Birmingham - Warwick Canal, now part of The Grand Union Canal,was built in the 1820's and is mainly used by leisure barges. There is a railway link to Moor Street Station through Olton and Acocks Green Stations. During the day there is a diesel train every 30 minutes with more frequent trains in the rush hour peaks. The adult fare is 65p return to the city. Children under 14 travel half fare and pensioners with passes go free The buses link up with the trains as both services are co-ordinated by the West Midlands P.T.E. Buses into Birmingham on the two main roads, the Coventry and Warwick Roads, are every 15 minutes during the day, at least. Several other buses connect up these roads.The two main roads connect the area with the M42 and the National Exhibition Centre.
